str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From kata and erchomai; to come down.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From Antiochus; Antiochia, a place in Syria.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) trans: I hand in, give up, (b) intrans: I give way (to the wind). From epi and didomi; to give over.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.
